body: No longer quality Been feeding our husky Blue Buffalo for years.  He needs the grain free food.  The last couple years I felt like it was going downhill in quality.  Dogs poop double the amount now.  The last few months we have seen a drastic change in each bag.  The color from bag to bag has changed and varies greatly.  The smell of the food is getting worse, I can't stand to open the closet it is stored in and it is inside of a container in that closet.  My dog doesn't want to eat it. My dog started having skin tags and fatty lumps.  They do come with age, but I consulted my vet.  My vet said Blue Buffalo is not good quality and she does not recommend their food.  She said multiple studies have shown the food does not use the quality ingredients like the ads claim and they do use crappy fillers.  I switched to science diet and now his skin and fat lumps are improving.  He really likes the new food.  Before he would refuse to eat for days other than a little here and there.  Now he is happy to be fed.  Will no longer buy Blue Buffalo products.
subject: Blue Buffalo Wilderness High Protein, Natural Adult Dry Dog Food, Chicken 24-lb

THEN I noticed individual kibble chunks with rot, mildew and mold scattered throughout the rest of the bag. body: horrible experience I did not purchase this product from Amazon but would like to leave my experience, as there're many people buying from Amazon.  I have heard of some dog foods making dogs sick, but never had the experience before.  Not this one.  I have two dogs and one is very picky, so I was looking for a good brand that they would like to eat.  I gave Blue Buffalo chicken first.  They ate, but one of them started refusing it, so I decided to switch to grain-free salmon.  Within a week they got horrible horrible diarrhea.  One couldn't stop himself and in the end it became all brown water at every 45 minutes.  I took both to a vet and they got medication, ate rice and chicken for several days and I thought it finally cured them.  I did not suspect it was food, so started mixing small amount again.  Then they're back to the horrible diarrhea again.  I had both dogs for many years (one is 17, the other 8) and they never had any issue with dog food.  This is a horrible, horrible product.  If I could, I would like them to reimburse all medical cost and their sufferings.  Stay away by all means,  do not believe the high rating.  This is seriously dangerous.

body: Do not feed this to your dog as the only food he eats Our Siberian husky had digestive problems most of his life and it kept getting worse along with his health. This seemed to be the only food he would eat. Constant diarrhea. He started limping and we thought it was getting close to the time to put him down. Hair started falling out on his tail. That was a few years ago. Now my dog runs, plays, has normal  movements and could not be happier. What did we do? We now cook all his food, He eats the dog healthy parts of human food, boiled chicken, turkey, rice, tuna, salmon, other meats, table scraps, green beans, sweet potatoes, and other veggies. All of this is simply garnished with Blue Buffalo, but that is the last thing left in the bowl. When he is still hungry, he eats the Blue. Take this for what it is worth. He also gets quite a few supplements and has been placed on thyroid medicine. Also avoid too many dog treats.

body: Caused dietary issues for my pup Decided to try slowly integrating this food into our dog's regular food (Hills Science Diet) since she was having some early morning urgency to go outside and eat grass.... for 15-20 minutes. It was only ever in the morning and would sometimes happen 2-3x before she'd feel better and eat her breakfast (she's a beagle so normally she scarfs down any meal ASAP). Googled it, and thought maybe she wasn't getting enough nutrients in her diet. So we slowly started incorporating blue buffalo into her meals. Almost immediately we noticed she was gassy, with foul smelling farts. Her tummy would gurgle, and she wasn't as interested in her meals. We gave it a few days before I called our vet for advice. She said, and I quote: "9 times out of 10 when I see a dog coming in with some digestive issues, they're being fed Blue Buffalo." She advised we go with a dog food brand that is larger and more well-known, such as Hills or even Purina, she said, because those companies do more testing and quality control than the smaller companies like Blue Buffalo. I was surprised by this, since I've heard Purina food is trash, and I thought Blue Buffalo was well known and a big brand like Hills or the like, but I guess not! Anyway, long story short, once we stopped using even a little of Blue Buffalo she stopped eating grass (even though this behavior had started before we incorporated BB) and has been fine ever since. yay!

body: Food is garbage Been using Blue for about a year or so and very recently this formula. With a wolfs face dominating the package and the formula titled “Nature’s Evolutionary Diet,” along with claims of being 100% grain free, and the Blue brands overall reputation for making high quality dog food I’m honestly in shock at the amount of waste being emitted from my dog. Her breed requires higher amounts of protein than others which could be the reason for such dramatic results but either way it tells me the food is garbage. A dog will generally poop once after every feeding if receiving the correct amount of food for their breed, size, and activity level. Other things to look for are color, hardness, and size of the stool of course. I’ve noticed the higher the protein content the darker the stool. The bottom line is if a pet food brand HONESTLY cares about the quality of pet food they make the same standards of quality will be reflected in everything they produce. Very disappointed.
